title: Bold Futura, but not quite
content:
Hi! Would like to seek help in identifying the font in the attached image. Looks like modified Futura (TEE) Bold to me.

I think the R gives it away, but I am having doubts with the S.

Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818171910im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo2_3446.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo2.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818171910/http:/typophile.com/files/logo2_1.png) | 15.01 KB |
author: Claudine

comments.content: I think it's ITC Avant Garde Gothic Bold (which has a close-loop default R unlike other digital cuts of Avant Garde, surprising for such a high profile face—although of course this is the "original"). It also has all those famous leaning letters: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/std-bold/glyphs.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818171910/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/std-bold/glyphs.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/std-bold/glyphs.html")
